comments: Dr. Tandon is a phenomenal professor. The class is structured on group work. I cant emphasize the importance of being in a good group. You have to study and work for your grade. Midterm and final are fair and he gives extra credit. Everyone has the potential to get an A in this course. Don\'t skip class. Your group won\'t appreciate that.

stu_tags: INSPIRATIONAL  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
comments: You will obtain a more comprehensive understanding of finance from any other professor than Dr. Tandon. You\'re going to be challenged and you are going to be expected to come to class and study hard. Every student has a fair shot at getting an A in this course and, upon completing it, I think you will feel prepared to begin a career in the field.

comments: Dr. Tandon is the best finance professor I have had the opportunity to take a class with. He is not intimidating by any means, is straightforward about what he expects as well as teaching, and cares about your thoughts and choices post-graduation. Cases are a handful but he is always there to help assuming you\'ve made an attempt. STUDY!

comments: Expects you to know what hes talking about; not really showing how to do probs. Projects &HW overlap. I feel like class is a waste bc I have a hard time understanding what hes talking about. Id rather skip class& study because I believe Im not going to learn. Its a very stressful class right before graduating. His teaching style is not for me.

comments: After reviewing some of the comments I think it\'s ridiculous that they do not comment accurately about the class. He gave us a curve for both the midterm and final exam. THIS CLASS IS A LOT OF WORK & HE PUSHED DUE DATES BACK which made everyone uneasy. Ive never had a teacher actually take the time to make us understand the concepts though.

comments: This class is not a free ride but you will learn a lot if you pay attention! Sit in the first 2 rows so that you can get to know him better and he will make sure that you are understanding the topics. He is tough and does not sugar coat anything but really cares about your success not only in the class but also after graduation.

comments: Good luck if you need to take this class. Make sure you are in a good group, don\'t take the homework problems lightly and study a lot for the final. Study the whole book for the final because it covers a lot more than what he tells you in class.

comments: He did not have clear dates set on what is due when, the homework is a lot of work but it is very rewarding. There were two tests, the midterm which was two parts was easy, while the final was something unreal and impossible to finish. The group projects are a lot of work and he doesn\'t grade anything above a 85 no matter how good the writing was.

comments: In class Tandon can seem intimidating, but when you get to know him he is very nice. But in class he is terrifying. Make sure you have a good group to do the group projects with and make sure you do work otherwise they are free to kick you out. He has two tests, the midterm is easy but the final is completely different than what he tells you.

comments: I took him fall 2015, He is extremely engaging. He makes you truly understand concepts that have been taught to FIN majors , and apply them. 2 exams and 2-3 cases. Pick a good team and this class is smooth sailing. He\'ll try to scare you , but youll like him by the end. DONT SKIP!

stu_tags: GROUP PROJECTS  TOUGH GRADER  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: I am currently taking this class and I would recommend taking financial modeling prior to this course since every class so far has been excel based. Also keep all of your notes and homework assignments from advanced corp. finance cause you will work some of the same problems in his assigned homework. 30% of your grade depends on group projects.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (6)  TEST HEAVY (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Get ready to read (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: He is a very good professor. I think he tries to come off tougher than he really is. Case projects are not too hard if you divide work up among your group. He is very good at presenting material in class. 5 extra points on your exams for doing homework problems. I got a 96 on the first exam; idk why everyone thinks they are tough. They aren\'t.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (6)  TEST HEAVY (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Get ready to read (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: Dr. Tandon is brilliant. He claims there is no extra credit, but doing homework (his answers are online) earns you about 5% E.C. on each of the exams. He is a great educator and he instills work ethic in most people who don\'t have it. He grades very fairly. He is very respectful and creates an environment of equality.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (6)  TEST HEAVY (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Get ready to read (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: Tests are pretty tough, but he goes over the material on it. About half conceptual and half arithmetic. Accent makes it difficult to understand sometimes, but he is an excellent professor. Just work on the case studies and you\'ll be fine. It\'s impossible to get an A, or an F. Class of ~65 students, 2 A\'s, 0 F/D. FIN 4414. Class avg was ~84.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (6)  TEST HEAVY (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Get ready to read (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: Good professor. Very knowledgable. Hard exams, but you will learn a lot and the cases help passing the class (he grades it between 80 and 90 and they worth half of the final grade). Nice and does care about students. Attendance is mandatory. You\'ll also need your laptop to keep up with Excel assignments at every class. Slow on posting grades.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (6)  TEST HEAVY (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Get ready to read (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: His exams are very hard and the class average is always extremely low. The case studies are life savers to pass the class! I had him for FIN 3403 & this class and his exams are same format for both. He is really nice and cares about the students, but his accent doesn\'t help things.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (6)  TEST HEAVY (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Get ready to read (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Caring (1)  Inspirational (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: Took this class over the summer. Very intimidating at first. Group cases were tough & time consuming but he graded easier than he said he would. 2 super hard tests. I suggest using the textbook from Corp Fin as a reference. Class is not mandatory but be there or be lost. You\'ll also need your laptop to keep up with Excel assignments.

comments: Very knowledgeable and helpful. Tests are hard even if he says they are not. Probably toughest class I\'ve taken for my major. Slow on posting grades.
